author: Kult_Of_Gorthaur
text:
Keep this under your hat, but I nabbed a healthy nugget of wisdom from one of the Telemundo commentators a few days ago, and it relates to ball possession.

So, reportedly, the team with the least amount of ball possession tires faster than the team with the ball consistently in play, which sounds like a winning strategy any way you slice it. So, ultimately, ball possession equates to tiring the other team out, while increasing one's own chances to score as much as possible.

author: Militop
text:
Ball possession also means that you're behind in the score, and you must try to keep the ball so you have a chance of catching up.

From what I've seen, almost every team relaxes their game when they're leading
